Any healthy community starts with affordable housing, and Indian Country is no different. 

We’ve got to work together to come up solutions that address the housing crisis leaving Native folks in Montana and around this country behind. https://t.co/syDJvnBEcQ

My colleague and fellow farmer @ChuckGrassley is throwing his support behind my bill, the #SeedingRuralResilienceAct. We need to tackle the mental health challenges our farmers and ranchers face in rural America, and this bill aims to do just that. https://t.co/8gh2vqC2Z3

Time for our boys in blue and gold to #SackSacState and add another win to their incredible season. Happy homecoming to all the @MontanaState alums and everyone who made it out to Bozeman today—looking forward to another win in Bobcat Country! #GoCatsGo https://t.co/7PX25lJ2mZ

Thanks to the nearly 150 folks who came to my town hall at @TheShaneCenter in Livingston. These public, in-person town halls put me in the hot seat and help you hold me accountable. With your feedback, I can help make Washington look a bit more like Montana. https://t.co/Dh88cctYFy

This bill helps connect rural areas with more resources to address mental health care, and takes aim at reducing the stigma against reaching out for help. 

Our farmers and ranchers work hard to provide for us—we need to work hard for them.

On #WorldMentalHealthDay, we cannot leave rural America out of the conversation. Our farmers and ranchers face serious challenges to receiving mental health care—isolation, a lack of broadband and telehealth opportunities, and the stigma against asking for help.

The @UMGRIZZLIES went on the road last week and let everyone know who’s boss. I know they’ll do it again at home today with the help of their great alumni – happy homecoming everybody! Good luck and #GoGriz! https://t.co/8cfrx6FEWZ

Thanks to everyone who came out to MSU Billings today to have a frank conversation about the issues facing our state and our country. I always appreciate hearing from you and that you hold me accountable. I’m looking forward to seeing you at my next in-person town hall.

I just got a question about suicide rates in Montana. I've got a bill to address this crisis that would be a good start, but we have to keep pushing. We need more mental health professionals on the ground and we have to reduce the stigma around mental health in rural America.

Just got a question about legislative gridlock in the Senate. We're supposed to be the greatest deliberative body in the world, but we don't debate much anymore. If we actually did the work of debating the issues, I think we'd come up with a whole heckuva lot more solutions.

A man who has spent his entire career calling for the sale of public lands should not be in charge of them – plain and simple. William Perry Pendley’s position at BLM puts Montana’s public lands and outdoor way of life at risk. 

He should be replaced. Immediately. https://t.co/1wSAcZEgao

Producers face shortages of mental health professionals and battle stigmas that prevent them from seeking help. This bill creates a stress detection and prevention program, a wellness promotional campaign, and a collaborative task force to address this important issue.

The Trump Administration recently announced that the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services adopted my bill into their rule changes, helping these hospitals around the country meet the needs of folks in rural communities. Read more HERE ➡️ https://t.co/mqiPHPHxJT 3/3

These hospitals face a shortage of doctors, forcing many Montanans to drive long distances to find treatment. So, I introduced my Restoring Rural Residencies Act to help these hospitals recruit residents and encourage them to establish practices in rural communities. 2/3

It was an honor to be recognized by the Billings Clinic today for my work to help recruit more doctors for Montana’s Critical Access Hospitals. These hospitals serve our state’s most rural areas, helping folks who don’t live close to cities get access to health care. 1/3 https://t.co/CrlP1E76vs

We must get politics out of the exam room and allow patients to make their own choices about their health care. 

We must #ProtectX.

This gag rule prevents Title X grantees like @PPFA from doing their jobs—giving comprehensive information and potentially life-saving care to patients. 

This rule will prevent folks from all over—including those in rural areas—from accessing the health care they need.

.@PPFA serves 40% of patients nationwide who receive care through Title X-funded centers. The Administration’s gag rule prohibits health care providers who receive Title X funding from informing patients about how or where they can access reproductive care. 

That’s wrong.

1 in 10 Montanans rely on our state's 65 community health centers for vital care—especially folks in rural areas. 

Funding for these essential centers is set to expire on Sept. 30 unless Congress acts. I'm urging the Senate to fund them immediately. 

Lives are depending on it. https://t.co/QaMdmsizOX
Medical residents can now train at Montana’s 48 Critical Access Hospitals and at hundreds more across the country—helping ensure health care is more accessible in communities across rural America.
As I travel across Montana, I hear from folks who work tirelessly everyday to make ends meet — families facing the ever-rising costs of housing, healthcare, and other basic necessities.

I met with @PPAdvocatesMT to discuss ways we can protect Title X funding, which helps more than 20,000 Montanans get affordable healthcare each year. 
The Administration’s actions will cause real harm to women and their families by jeopardizing their healthcare. We must #ProtectX https://t.co/4bosJO0ivd
